cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.GT.

This paper deals with the problem of secure communication, specifically in the context of the Russian cards problem. This problem is a classic example in cryptography and falls under the category of secure communication. The paper proposes a new notion of security, which is an intermediate between weak security and perfect security. This notion of security involves probabilistic information and is related to information theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category for this paper is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Additionally, the paper also involves the use of geometric strategy, which is a well-known concept in game theory and falls under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also involves the use of probability theory and information theory, which are relevant to the sub-categories of cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper involves the analysis of the complexity of the proposed strategy, which is related to the sub-category of cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory).
